content.description: Use "Improve this page" if you know!
content.location: Sit start in the center of the boulder.

content.description:
Sit start on the shared starting jug shield as for XXX (Turned the opposite direction). Traverse out right on a couple crimps, sidepulls, jugs, and pinches with rather poor feet, working towards the higher dihedral. Once established on obvious holds in the middle of the dihedral work straight up to better holds for the easier top out.

I start with both hands on the top of the shield with left heel on the lower part of the shield, which is opposite the standard start for XXX (hands low, heel high).
content.location: Center of the XXX boulder, but traverses right instead of left.

content.description:
Start on two good incut edges at the bottom of the roof. Decide on your beta, then traverse left on slopey holds to gain better holds before an engaging, but not so difficult top out.

Two low start options exist that bump the grade up a fair bit. Either sit start underneath on a couple bad holds, or start on the far right side and traverse in.
content.location: On the right side of the XXX boulder. Locate the start holds about midway in the blocky roof. Traverses left.

content.description: Start left hand on sharp incut crimp and right on low pinch. Use heal-toe cam to move up small crimps on face to slopers above. Top out directly above start.
content.location: Starts left of iron chuff and right of bounce.
